images.text_verbatim:
FOUNDATION PLAN
SCALE: 3/16" = 1'-0"
26'-0"
24'-0"
THICKEN SLAB @ POST LOCATION TO BE 2'-6" x 2'-6"
images.summary: This foundation plan shows the layout of the foundation for a 2-storey garage. The plan is scaled at 3/16" = 1'-0" and outlines the dimensions of the foundation as 26'-0" by 24'-0". A thickened slab is indicated at the post location, measuring 2'-6" x 2'-6". The plan provides a top-down view of the foundation slab and includes notes for thickening the slab at specific post locations.

images.text_verbatim:
TYPICAL EDGE DETAIL
SCALE: 3/8" = 1'-0"
6x6 6 GA. WWF OR 16" x 16" x 10M GRID OR FIBRE MESH
(4) RUNS 15M REBAR MIN. 3" COVER
COMPACTED GRANULAR 'A'
2" (R-10) OF EXTRUDED POLYSTYRENE MIN. COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF 30 PSI
WOOD STUD w/ SIDING
SILL PLATE & GASKET
1/2" Ø ANCHOR BOLTS @ 48" o.c. (LEAVE OPENING IN SILL PLATE FOR DOOR LOCATIONS)
SLOPE GRADE AWAY 2%
2" (R-10) OF EXTRUDED POLYSTYRENE MIN. COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF 30 PSI
CONTINUE INSULATION VERTICALLY UP TO 2' BELOW GRADE
6 MIL POLY VAPOUR BARRIER
images.summary: This typical edge detail illustrates the construction of the foundation edge for the garage. The detail is scaled at 3/8" = 1'-0" and includes components such as 6x6 6 GA. welded wire fabric (WWF) or a 16" x 16" x 10M grid, and fibre mesh. Four runs of 15M rebar with a minimum 3" cover are specified. The foundation includes compacted granular 'A' and 2" (R-10) extruded polystyrene with a minimum compressive strength of 30 PSI. A wood stud with siding, sill plate, gasket, and 1/2" Ø anchor bolts at 48" on center are detailed. The grade is sloped away at 2%, and insulation continues vertically up to 2' below grade. A 6 mil poly vapour barrier is also included.

images.text_verbatim:
MAIN FLOOR
(2) 1-3/4" x 11-7/8" LVL 2.0E (2) JACKS & (2) KINGS
W12x45 STEEL BEAM
TYP DECK 2x4 PT JOIST @ 16" o.c.
5/4 PT DECKING
FASTEN DECK RIM TO GARAGE W/ 2" BOLTS @ 16" o.c. STAGGERED
TYP 6x6 PT COLUMNS IN H.G. CARPORT SADDLE IN 19" Ø CONCRETE COLUMN
SCALE: 3/16" = 1'-0"
26'-0"
24'-0"
images.summary: The main floor plan for the garage is detailed, showing the layout and dimensions of the ground floor. The plan is scaled at 3/16" = 1'-0" and includes a W12x45 steel beam and engineered joists. The floor plan specifies (2) 1-3/4" x 11-7/8" LVL 2.0E beams with (2) jacks and (2) kings. Typical deck construction includes 2x4 pressure-treated joists at 16" on center and 5/4 pressure-treated decking. The deck rim is fastened to the garage with 2" bolts at 16" on center, staggered. Typical 6x6 pressure-treated columns are set in high-grade carport saddles in 19" Ø concrete columns. Section callouts A/24, B/25, and C/26 indicate connections to other views.

images.text_verbatim:
LOFT FLOOR
SCALE: 3/16" = 1'-0"
26'-3"
24'-0"
ENGINEERED SCISSOR TRUSSES @ 24" o.c.
ENGINEERED ATTIC TRUSSES @ 24" o.c.
images.summary: The loft floor plan provides the layout for the mezzanine level of the garage. The plan is scaled at 3/16" = 1'-0" and includes engineered scissor trusses and attic trusses spaced at 24" on center. The dimensions are 26'-3" by 24'-0". Section callouts A/24, B/25, and C/26 indicate connections to other views. The plan ensures proper support and load distribution for the mezzanine level.

ASPHALT SHINGLES
36" EAVE PROTECTION
1/2" SPRUCE PLYWOOD ROOF SHTG
ENGINEERED SCISSOR TRUSSES @ 24" o.c.

HOUSEWRAP

images.summary: Cross Section A provides a longitudinal view of the garage, detailing the wall and roof construction. The section is scaled at 1/4" = 1'-0" and includes asphalt shingles, 36" eave protection, and 1/2" spruce plywood roof sheathing. Engineered scissor trusses are spaced at 24" on center. The walls feature vinyl siding, housewrap, 1/2" plywood wall sheathing, and 2x6 studs at 24" on center. Anchor bolts are 1/2" Ø at 48" on center, with a 2x6 sill plate and foam sill gasket. The engineered slab is noted with a reference to engineered details. The section illustrates the relationship between different structural components across multiple levels, including the top of the subfloor, plate, and floor at 10'-0". Section callout A/24 indicates a connection to other views.

CROSS SECTION B

HURRICANE TIES (TYP)

2x10 FLR JSTS @ 16" o.c.

VINYL SIDING
HOUSEWRAP
1/2" PLY WALL SHTG

TOP OF PLATE
TOP OF SUBFLOOR
2x6 OR 2x8 NAILER (MATCH BEAM FLANGE WIDTH) FASTENED TO STEEL BEAM w/ 1/2" BOLTS @ 24"o.c. (STAGGER SIDES OF FLANGE)
1/2" Ø ANCHOR BOLTS @ 48" o.c.

images.summary: This section view, labeled 'Cross Section B', provides a transverse view of a garage, highlighting key structural elements such as the roof and floor construction. The roof is covered with asphalt shingles and features 36-inch eave protection. The roof structure includes 1/2-inch spruce plywood sheathing and engineered scissor trusses spaced at 24 inches on center. Hurricane ties are noted as typical. The floor system consists of 5/8-inch tongue and groove floor sheathing, glued and nailed to 2x10 floor joists spaced at 16 inches on center, with 2x2 'X' bridging at midspan. The walls are constructed with vinyl siding, housewrap, and 1/2-inch plywood wall sheathing, supported by 2x6 studs spaced at 24 inches on center. The section also details the use of 1/2-inch diameter anchor bolts at 48 inches on center, a 2x6 sill plate, and a foam sill gasket. An engineered slab is noted, with further details to be seen in engineering documents.

images.summary: This section view, labeled 'Cross Section C', provides a transverse view of a garage, focusing on structural details. The roof is covered with asphalt shingles and includes 36-inch eave protection. The roof structure is composed of 1/2-inch spruce plywood sheathing and engineered attic trusses spaced at 24 inches on center. The floor sheathing is 5/8-inch tongue and groove, glued and nailed to the bottom chord of the truss. Hurricane ties are noted as typical. The walls feature vinyl siding, housewrap, and 1/2-inch plywood wall sheathing, supported by 2x6 studs spaced at 24 inches on center. The section also specifies 1/2-inch diameter anchor bolts at 48 inches on center, a 2x6 sill plate, and a foam sill gasket. An engineered slab is mentioned, with additional details available in engineering documents.

images.summary: This image shows the right elevation of a building. The elevation is scaled at 3/16" = 1'-0". The building features vinyl siding and a staircase leading to a platform with a 42-inch high guardrail, which is compliant with SB-7 O.B.C. standards. The elevation provides a side view of the building, highlighting the exterior finishes and safety features.

Forming Part of Sentence 9.23.16.2.(1)
Item Column 1 Column 2
Maximum Spacing of Supports, mm Panel Mark
1. 406 W16
2. 508 W20
3. 610 W24
images.summary: This image presents a schedule titled 'Table 9.23.16.2.B.' which rates wall sheathing when applying CAN/CSA-0325.0 standards. It forms part of Sentence 9.23.16.2.(1). The table lists maximum spacing of supports in millimeters alongside corresponding panel marks. The entries include: 406 mm with panel mark W16, 508 mm with panel mark W20, and 610 mm with panel mark W24. This schedule is essential for determining appropriate wall sheathing based on support spacing and panel specifications.
